head.title: Pouring Cold Water On Mideast Hopes

hedline.hl1: Pouring Cold Water On Mideast Hopes

abstract.p: Letter from Robert W Lebovits notes that Amos Oz, longtime advocate of Palestinian state, is now stunned to see Yasir Arafat given hero's welcome for refusing peace offerings Oz has promoted all these years (July 28 Op-Ed)

block.p: Re ''The Specter of Saladin,'' by Amos Oz (Op-Ed, July 28):

The irony in Mr. Oz's plight is too compelling to ignore. For more than 30 years he has been calling for the acceptance of a Palestinian state as the means for achieving a lasting peace. For more than 30 years resisters of his peace movement have warned that no amount of concerns or conciliation will satisfy the Palestinians because they want Israel, not peace.
Re ''The Specter of Saladin,'' by Amos Oz (Op-Ed, July 28):

The irony in Mr. Oz's plight is too compelling to ignore. For more than 30 years he has been calling for the acceptance of a Palestinian state as the means for achieving a lasting peace. For more than 30 years resisters of his peace movement have warned that no amount of concerns or conciliation will satisfy the Palestinians because they want Israel, not peace.
And now Mr. Oz watches in stunned silence as Yasir Arafat, the Palestinian leader, is given a hero's welcome for refusing the very peace offerings he had promoted all these years.
Who has been correct about the Palestinians after all?
